verses.text: 底波拉和巴拉之歌那一天，底波拉和亞比挪菴的兒子巴拉唱起歌來說：

words.note: Classical possessive particle, similar to '的'.
'起...來' structure indicates the start of an action.

verses.text: 「你們要稱頌耶和華，因為以色列中有勇士，因為有人民自願從軍。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts to praise God.
Refers to the people or nation of Israel.

verses.text: 君王啊，你們要聽；官長啊，你們要側耳傾聽；至於我，我要向耶和華歌唱；我要歌頌耶和華以色列的 神。

words.note: Lit. 'side ear', meaning to lean an ear to listen carefully.
'傾' here implies focus and attentiveness.
Stronger than '歌唱', implying praising through song.
Refers to God, the Deity, in this context.

verses.text: 耶和華啊，你從西珥出發的時候，你從以東地行走的日子，地震天漏，密雲也滴下雨。

words.note: Connects verb phrase to '時候', forming a temporal clause.
Connects verb phrase to '日子', forming a temporal clause.
Poetic description for torrential rain.

verses.text: 群山在耶和華面前震動；這西奈山在耶和華以色列的 神面前也是這樣。

words.note: '群' indicates a group or multitude of mountains.

verses.text: 在亞拿的兒子珊迦的時候，在雅億的日子，大道無人行走，行路的人繞道而行。

words.note: Refers to major roads.
Literally 'walk road'.

verses.text: 以色列中的農村消失了，消失了，直到我底波拉興起，直到我以色列的母親興起。

words.note: Often used in biblical context for leaders or movements.
Often used in biblical context for leaders or movements.

verses.text: 以色列人選擇了新的神，戰爭就臨近城門；那時四萬以色列人中，竟不見有一面盾牌、一枝長矛。

breakdown.m: side, face; classifier for flat objects
branch; classifier for long, slender things

verses.text: 我的心傾向以色列的官長，他們在民中甘願犧牲自己；你們要稱頌耶和華。

words.note: Refers to civil or military leaders.
Originally referred to sacrificial animals, now broader 'sacrifice'.

verses.text: 騎白驢的，坐錦墊的，和路上的行人，你們都要歌唱。

words.definition: on the road, along the way

verses.text: 在打水的地方分開羊群的人發聲，在那裡人必歌頌耶和華公義的作為，就是他在以色列中的農村所行公義的作為；那時，耶和華的子民下到城門口。

words.note: Indicates the object of the verb or a passive construction.

verses.text: 興起，興起，底波拉！興起，興起，唱歌吧！興起，巴拉！亞比挪菴的兒子，擄掠你的俘虜吧！
那時餘剩的貴胄下來；耶和華帶著勇士下到我這裡來。
他們出自以法蓮，他們的根在亞瑪力人之地；有便雅憫在你的族人中跟隨你，有官長從瑪吉下來；有持著數點民數之權杖的（「數點民數」意思不明確，或譯﹕「經學家」或「指揮官」），從西布倫出來。

words.note: Classical Chinese possessive particle, similar to '的'.
The original text notes the meaning is unclear, possibly 'scribes' or 'commanders'.
Classical Chinese possessive particle, similar to '的'.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun, meaning 'those who...' or 'the ones who...'.

verses.text: 以薩迦的領袖與底波拉在一起；以薩迦怎樣，巴拉也怎樣；他們都步行下到山谷去。在流本的眾溪旁，有心懷大志的。

words.note: Often used in biblical texts to denote a multitude.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun, meaning 'those who...'.

verses.text: 你為甚麼坐在羊圈之中，聽呼喚群畜的笛聲呢？在流本的眾溪旁，有心懷大志的。
基列人在約旦河東邊居住；但人為甚麼居留在船上呢？亞設人在海岸坐著，在港灣居住。
西布倫人是敢死的民族；拿弗他利人在田野的高處，奮不顧身。

words.note: An idiom meaning to disregard one's own safety.

verses.text: 眾王都來爭戰；那時迦南眾王爭戰，在米吉多水亭的他納爭戰，卻沒有取得銀錢。

words.note: Refers to the 'waters of Megiddo' in Judges 5.

verses.text: 眾星從天上爭戰，從它們的軌道與西西拉交戰。
基順河的急流把他們沖沒，古河的急流、基順河的急流，我的心哪，你要努力踐踏。

words.note: Verb-complement structure indicating completion of action.
Implies aggressive or triumphant treading.

verses.text: 那時馬蹄沓沓，勇士急奔飛馳。

words.note: Onomatopoeic, describing the sound of hooves.

verses.text: 耶和華的使者說：『你們要咒詛米羅斯，大大咒詛其中的居民；因為他們不來幫助耶和華，不帶領勇士幫助耶和華。』

words.note: Often refers to angels in biblical context.
Reduplication emphasizes intensity.

verses.text: 願基尼人希伯的妻子雅億，比眾婦女更有福氣，比住在帳棚的婦女更有福氣。

words.note: Common in biblical contexts for dwelling.

verses.text: 西西拉求水，雅億給了奶；用珍貴的盤子奉上乳酪。

words.note: Indicates offering with deference or respect.

verses.text: 她伸手拿著帳棚的橛子，右手拿著匠人的鎚子，擊打西西拉，打破他的頭，粉碎他的頭顱，貫穿他的鬢角。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical contexts for 'tent'.
Specifically refers to tent pegs in biblical narratives.

verses.text: 西西拉在雅億腳前屈身、仆倒、躺臥，在雅億腳前屈身、仆倒；他在那裡屈身，就在那裡仆倒死亡。

words.note: Often a noun 'death', but verb 'die' here.

verses.text: 西西拉的母親從窗戶裡向外觀望，從窗櫺中呼叫說：『他的戰車為甚麼遲遲不來呢？車輪為甚麼行得緩慢呢？』

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here.
Refers to the cross-bars of a window.
Used as a locative suffix here.
Commonly found in historical and biblical texts.
Reduplication emphasizes slowness or delay.
Indicates degree or result following a verb.

verses.text: 聰明的宮女回答她；她也自己回答說：

words.note: Refers to female attendants in an imperial palace.

verses.text: 『莫非他們正在分戰利品？每個勇士分得一兩個女子；西西拉得了彩衣作戰利品，得了一兩件繡花的彩衣作戰利品，為我的頸項，得著繡花的彩衣作戰利品嗎？』

words.note: Used to express a rhetorical question or speculation.
Commonly used in historical/military contexts.
Verb-complement structure meaning 'to obtain through distribution'.
Often implies richly decorated or embroidered clothing.
Commonly used in historical/military contexts.
Often implies richly decorated or embroidered clothing.
Commonly used in historical/military contexts.
Implies successful acquisition, often with an enduring state.
Often implies richly decorated or embroidered clothing.
Commonly used in historical/military contexts.

verses.text: 耶和華啊，願你所有的仇敵都這樣滅亡；願愛他的人像太陽出現，大有能力。」於是國中太平了四十年。

words.note: Often used in phrases like '大有能力' (have great power).
